Game good. I'm super sleepy, but I wanna leave a review.
Like Smash Bros, conceptually? This is the Horror version of that. Settle it in the fog!

This game is great! When playing survivor, you can either be in 2 gameplay factors, doing skill checks on gens or wasting the killers time by looping so your teammates can complete the objective. As the killer, your experience always depends on the type of survivors your get. If they're bad, you might find killer a relaxing time. If the survivors are good, then you might define killer as "mind-games, the game" (same thing goes for when you're a survivor and you're playing against a good killer). Like tf2, the game has a steep learning curve (not as steep as tf2). However, like tf2 the tutorial barley teaches you how to play the game, and I feel like that sucks for newer players. It doesn't teach you about the killer abilities, it doesn't teach you how to loop, it just, a terrible way of teaching.

Honestly a broken mess of a game that was a lot better in its prime. Still a fantastic mess that's, at times, worth the price, but can also be hot garbage. How can you balance/fix a game when both the killer and survivor playerbases think they're the weak ones and need buffs? Spoiler: You can't and someone is always going to be mad... But you can throw a pallet down, teabag and blind killers still, so yup.

Ever watched a horror movie and thought, "I kinda wanna be the killer". Then this is the game for you. Playing as the survivor however turns the game from a killer simulator to an actually terrifying game. Mostly because it's not an AI playing who you can exploit and predict it's movements, but because it's a real person playing.

Just remembered this is the company that messed up eternal crusade so yeah don't give them money.

Edit: More time added since friends insist on playing from time to time. Still trash with a trash dev team. Pretty obvious the new characters are designed to be stronger just to sell em.

I have uninstalled this game more times than I can count. It's addictive, sure. But the bad kind of addiction. Like an abusive relationship, you'll sit there and take the frustrations, aggravations, and general heartache until there's that one moment of love. Then suffer the abuse some more. As a survivor, you'll be facecamped by an insidious bubba, or hounded by a spirit with high tier movement perks. You'll be slugged while your gens' progress is regressed to zero. Your teammates will crouchwalk the entire map. As a killer, I dunno. you'll get flashlighted and teabagged. Seriously, killers complain a lot but their add ons are far more effective than anything the survivors bring in. I'm looking at you, iridescent heads. Then, maybe the 50th game of the night, the stars align and the killer is on your level and not resorting to cheap trolling and your fellow survivors know what they're doing. And even though you died, the game was close and exhilarating. And you forget about all the bad and ready up once more. For your own sanity, however, stay away. The good is not worth all the salt this game shoves down your throat.

I had alot of fun with this game with friends, more on playstation. However right now i cant recommend playing this game. Ever sensce the newish matchmaking system, I rarely have fun in the game. every match is way too similar now. I watched my friend play his first match of killer, which for me about 4 years ago, was great fun. but in his FIRST match there were survivers that were clearly WAY better than him, I checked their accounts, and they has hundreds of hour in the game vs. my friends 4 hours. that is not fair, It was painful to watch the match. He didnt get anyone hooked once, thats not a good matchmaking system. ive played the majority of this game as surviver, but i did play killer every few matches, but i cant anymore, its always so stressful and boring. When or if they change this shitty match making system, ill update the review

This game keeps me up at night. I have spent hours lying in bed plotting and scheming, deciding my next moves, my next alliances, my next betrayals. This is one of my favorite games all year, which is why this is the first game I have reviewed. I highly recommend it to anybody who either loves strategy, or screwing all of your friends over. The multiplayer mode is just icing on the cake.

in the begining it was fun. i played on ps4 far longer than on pc (at least 10x more) lately it seems like the devs dont care. the game is going in a very bad direction and has been since its competetor (friday the 13th) was no longer a threat. for the first time in three years im not thinking living and breathing DBD. its glitchy, it balances things by the top% of players and says screw you to anyone else. 

So long DBD, it was fun for awhile... i hope to love you again someday

Un jeu qui a connu un très bon départ mais malgré les dlc avec des perso intéressant le jeu et complètement déséquilibrée si vous jouer survivant bonne chance ! c'est la fête des barre de chargement qui dure bien trop longtemps pour chaque action que vous faite et subir des tueurs avec des compétence "Innée" qui ne ce gêne pas pour bien les spam (0sec couldown).

Pour résumé si vous aimez la frustration ce jeu et fait pour vous, mais si vous voulez juste vous amusé passé votre chemin. 

NB : Friday the 13th: The Game et plus équilibré et fun que ce jeu si vous chercher un jeu du même type

Originally my review was "good game, don't die" however, I have to change this because I don't care for what the devs have been up to. The longer I played the game, the more I realized the major problems it had due to the devs being lazy. They don't fix things until they absolutely have to either because it's game breaking or they're losing a significant amount of players, their NFT involvement, and their lack of respect for the community. It hurts to put a negative review for a game I once loved, but the devs have ruined the game for me
